sentences.english: She was my BFF on the show and in real life.
sentences.chinese: 不管在节目上，还是实际生活中，她都是我的死党。

sentences.english: Joey and his buddies kicked off their summer vacation with a trip to the beach.
sentences.chinese: 乔伊和他的死党以一场海滩之旅来为璁假揭开序幕。

sentences.english: Yet Mr. Zhao’s compromises have damaged some of his closest friendships in China.
sentences.chinese: 不过，赵亮的妥协行为摧毁了国内一些死党关系。

sentences.english: I now have peace calling my former Best Friend a really good friend.
sentences.chinese: 我现在可以平静地称以往的死党为好朋友。

sentences.english: I have had a Best Friend for at 28 years now.
sentences.chinese: 我曾有个死党，至今已28年。

sentences.english: No words don't talk about chums, beautiful girlfriend, suitable work?
sentences.chinese: 无话不谈的死党，漂亮的女朋友，合适的工作？

sentences.english: At times, I felt that my Best Friend was very selfish.
sentences.chinese: 有时候我甚至觉得我的死党非常自私。

definition: erhua variant of 鐵哥們|铁哥们[tie3 ge1 men5]
(dialect) close childhood friend whom one grew up with/a couple who grew up as childhood friends
good friend/(slang) a visit from Aunt Flo (menstrual period)
a pack of rogues (idiom); a gang of scoundrels
to be in the same class/to be in the same squad/classmate
not to hold anything back (idiom)/(of close friends etc) to tell each other everything
to share vile habits/partners in notoriety/birds of a feather
